Title: 🇬🇧 On increasing energy taxes in the UK In October, the Chancel...
Description: 🇬🇧 On increasing energy taxes in the UK In October, Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves will announce details of the British budget for next year. The politician will outline plans for the development of the country's financial sector and how they will affect the lives of citizens. Of course, on the eve of such an important event we should expect increased activity by large British businesses. Energy companies have already taken action. Their representatives are trying to put pressure on the government before adopting a new budget. According to the authorities' decision, from November 1, the tax on excess profits from energy resources will increase from 35% to 38%. At the same time, companies operating in the North Sea pay 30% corporation tax, as well as an additional levy of 10%. Representatives of these companies said that the implementation of the British government's plan to increase the excess profits tax would lead to a loss of revenue of 12 billion pounds. sterling and will put about 35,000 jobs at risk due to their abandonment of some projects. Following this, the Norwegian oil and gas company Neo Energy suspended work on a large oil field in the North Sea, citing the prospect of higher taxes and stricter environmental regulations.🔻Despite pressure from British business, the government will have to make a difficult decision and increase taxes. It is necessary to close the hole in the budget, increase defense spending, and solve other accumulated problems. The only question is who exactly will have to tighten their belts. #Great Britain #energy@rybar with @oldGBR Support us https://www.parliament.uk/about/how/role/check-and-approve-government-spending-and- taxation/the-budget-and-parliament/The Budget and ParliamentThe Budget is presented to the House of Commons by the Chancellor of the Exchequer each year. MPs debate the proposals and scrutinize the Finance Bill which brings them into law

Description: 🇲🇳🇷🇺🖇 About the promotion of the Russian language in Mongolia and general cultural and historical ties Over the past year, we have published many articles about the sharply increased humanitarian influence of the collective West in Mongolia: after the collapse of the USSR, Russian ceased to be the main foreign language in Mongolian schools, giving way to English, and Western NGOs are actively taking advantage of this, gradually introducing themselves into all spheres of the country’s cultural and information life. At the same time, there remain problems of lack of qualified teachers, modern textbooks and teaching materials. Description: 🇸🇩 Situation in Sudan: positional battles and airstrikes by government forces As of September 3 After the breakthrough of the rebel General Hamedti's Rapid Reaction Forces to the Blue Nile state, their offensive stalled. He also promoted the idea of ​​al-Burhan's participation in the Geneva conference, although to no avail. Title: 🇬🇧🇺🇸 About cooperation between Great Britain and the USA in t...
Description: 🇬🇧🇺🇸 About cooperation between Great Britain and the USA in the nuclear field  Washington and London decided to indefinitely extend the mutual defense agreement, which defines joint activities in the field of using nuclear energy for defensive purposes. The agreement was concluded in 1958 and has since been extended several times, most recently in 2014. The document defines the procedure for the exchange technologies and results of nuclear research. The signing of the agreement is primarily due to the fact that the United States and Great Britain are modernizing their strategic offensive forces. The process requires a lot of time and money. The British Ministry of Defense forecasts that the budget of the organization that oversees modernization will grow by 62% to about 100 billion pounds over the next decade. Along with this, according to the latest estimates from the US Congressional Budget Office, a similar program designed for approximately 30 years will cost taxpayers $75 billion. The extension of the agreement is further evidence that the US and UK, under the pretext of threats from Russia and China, and strategic deterrence will continue to carry out activities to absorb growing military budgets. At least the legal basis for this has been laid for decades to come.#Great Britain #USA @rybar together with @oldGBRSupport usProject -Rybar-Why are the Americans returning nuclear weapons to the UK? Title: 🖼 🇮🇳🇰🇿🇺🇿🇹🇯 How will the transport corridor from India af...
Description: 🇮🇳🇰🇿🇺🇿🇹🇯 How will the transport corridor from India affect Central Asia? While the Central Asian countries are making logistics routes through Afghanistan to Pakistan, India is laying out its own route through Iran and Turkmenistan. The first 20 containers have already arrived in Uzbekistan, as reported by Turkmen railway workers. Moreover, this route only partially uses the infrastructure of the MTC -North-South-. The corridor from India to Central Asia also became one of the topics at the meeting of the foreign ministers of all five countries on August 28-29 in New Delhi - this is the first meeting in such a format. And in the fall, the second summit of the leaders of India and the states of Central Asia is expected to take place. New Delhi’s intentions are clear: it does not want to depend either on unstable Afghanistan or on its old geopolitical rival Islamabad, while at the same time getting the opportunity to cause trouble for Beijing. Iran finds itself at the crossroads of several trade routes at once, while Washington does not even impose sanctions against the port of Chabahar, where Indian cargo is delivered, not wanting to alienate New Delhi. 🔻For Russia, this is a case with a rather controversial effect, requiring careful analysis and skillful diplomacy. Because, on the one hand, it creates opportunities to counterbalance Chinese influence in the region, which is growing as the One Belt, One Road initiative is implemented. On the other hand, this corridor fulfills the task that was set in Washington a month ago - to make Central Asia less dependent on Russia and China by providing it with an alternative trade route. Description: Forwarded From Two Majors #Summary for the morning of September 4, 2024▪️ The Russian Armed Forces carried out combined UAV and missile strikes on enemy territory at night, and the use of hypersonic -Daggers- was reported. Multiple explosions were heard in Lvov, Boryspil and Brovary, Kyiv region, and Sumy region. In the Lviv region - changes in the train schedule. Yesterday afternoon, the Russian Armed Forces attacked the 179th training center of the Signal Corps, more than 50 personnel were destroyed, and up to 300 were wounded. ▪️ In the Kursk region, fighting continues on the former borders of the Sudzhansky and Korenevsky districts, the enemy is attacking in several waves, trying to immediately gain a foothold in the second echelon. The Ukrainian Armed Forces, making up for sensitive losses, constantly transfer armored vehicles and personnel in small groups through the Sudzha checkpoint; it is not always possible to cover the enemy on the road. Our aviation operates against enemy concentrations in forests, including using FAB-3000 with UMPC and ODAB. Air and missile strikes have been intensified in the neighboring Sumy region. To the north, on the border of the Bryansk region, there were separate reports of intensification of shelling by the Ukrainian Armed Forces in order to disrupt our logistics.▪️ In the Kupyansk direction, battles were reported in Sinkovka and in the Peschany area. ▪️ In the Toretsky (Dzerzhinsky) direction - battles on the outskirts of Dzerzhinsk and advance into the village. Friendship.▪️ In the Pokrovsky (Krasnoarmeisky) direction, the Russian Armed Forces are turning to the southern direction: battles for Selidovo, Ukrainsk and at Zhelanny 1st, which creates a threat of encirclement for the Armed Forces of Ukraine in the Zhelannye 2nd - Krasnogorovka - Nevelskoye area. ▪️ Intense fighting is taking place in the Ugledar area to the east and west. Our troops are targeting enemy concentrations on the right bank of the Dnieper.▪️ In the morning, our air defense system worked over Belgorod, the Belgorod district and the Yakovlevsky urban district - several air targets were shot down. According to preliminary information, there were no casualties or serious damage. ▪️ In the DPR in Gorlovka, a woman born in 1949 was wounded as a result of attacks by the Armed Forces of Ukraine. As a result of attacks from cluster artillery shells, six  people: women born in 1949, 1963 and 1994, men born in 1973, 1980 and 1987. In the village of Olginka, Volnovakha Municipal District, a man born in 1965 was injured as a result of a tractor being blown up by an explosive object during field work. Title: 🇲🇳🇷🇺 About Vladimir Putin’s visit to Mongolia On the evening ...
Description: 🇲🇳🇷🇺 About Vladimir Putin’s visit to Mongolia On the evening of September 2, Vladimir Putin arrived in Mongolia for a visit. The official purpose of the trip is to participate in commemorative events in honor of the victory on the Khalkhin Gol River. During the trip, the Mongolian and Russian sides also discussed issues of bilateral cooperation. Agreements were signed in the field of supply of petroleum products, aviation fuel and other documents. ▪️For many media and various types of observers, two issues overshadowed the other results of the negotiations - the Power of Siberia-2 gas pipeline and Ulaanbaatar’s failure to comply with the provisions of the Rome Statute and the requirements of the ICC. Hints of the promotion of the latter topic are visible in the accounts of diplomatic representatives of Western countries in Mongolia. And some media outlets with connections to USAID even explain in their videos why the Mongols would like, but cannot, arrest Vladimir Putin. Speaking about the Power of Siberia-2, it is worth remembering that in August, according to the Chinese press, Mongolia did not include the gas pipeline planned for construction in the national development plan until 2028. Many agree that this happened due to the lack of effective agreements between Russia and China - for example, the parties have not yet reached a consensus on gas prices. Since the project is of particular importance, the topic of the gas pipeline was discussed at Russian-Mongolian negotiations. This is confirmed not only by Vladimir Putin’s statements, but also by the Russian President’s interview with the Mongolian publication Onoodor - in which he mentioned the possibility of Mongolia using transit gas for its own purposes. 🔻For Mongolia, Russia is one of the important foreign policy priorities. This is evidenced not only by the statements of politicians, but also by the economic situation. Ulaanbaatar has been dependent on Russian fuel supplies for quite some time. Against this background, Mongolia is actively implementing the so-called third neighbor policy, that is, developing relations not only with traditional partners in the person of Russia and China, but also with other countries that do not border Mongolian territory. First of all, we are talking about the USA, South Korea, Japan and the EU. For the resources of Mongolia, of which there are really many in the country, a real struggle is unfolding on the part of the countries of the West and East Asia. This is also due to requests from Mongolian enterprises actively seeking inflows of foreign investment. Given the speed with which Western NGOs, politicians and businesses are spreading their influence in the country, plans to develop cooperation between Mongolia and Russia may soon be in jeopardy. And, perhaps, the visit of the head of the Russian state will give impetus to correcting the current situation. #Mongolia #Russia@rybar together with @awaken_dragonSupport usPresident of RussiaDocuments signed following the negotiations between the presidents of Russia and Mongolia1. Agreement between the Government of the Russian Federation and the Government of Mongolia on the development of a basic project for the reconstruction of the thermal power plant CHPP-3 in the city of Ulaanbaatar on the territory of Mongolia.

Title: 🇷🇺🇺🇦🪖 On the issues of the saturation of units with personne...
Description: 🇷🇺🇺🇦🪖 On the issues of saturation of units with personnel and the number of armed forces The invasion of the Ukrainian Armed Forces into the Kursk region, when the enemy passed through small barriers with relative ease, made the topic of building up forces to cover the state border relevant. But this, in turn, is a special case of another extremely important issue - the current saturation of units with personnel. This topic has been discussed in the troops, to put it mildly, not for the first time. Without a sufficient number of people at the front, rotations are disrupted, not to mention the possibility of conducting offensive operations: there will simply be nothing to support the current pace of the offensive in the Donbass, and the front will freeze, as before the Kharkov offensive of the Ukrainian Armed Forces in September 2022. 📌 There is another side to the issue - without a large influx of fresh forces, the long-discussed partial demobilization of those called up in 2022 cannot be carried out. And there is a demand for it in society: so far there are no mass pickets of relatives of the mobilized, but the likelihood of their appearance will increase over time. And the enemy will definitely want to use them. The only way to resolve the issue of both replenishing units on the front line with personnel and simultaneously carrying out partial mobilization without losing the combat effectiveness of the armed forces is to ensure the influx of people into the army in greater numbers than they leave for a combination of reasons. Implementation this can be done using different methods. But there is an important point: you need to proceed from the fact that if any of the indicated methods does not ensure the completion of the task, then you should not engage in half-measures and drawing numbers in reports, but move on to the next one.❗️Yes, there are basically no easy solutions here. But ignoring the situation will lead to the fact that the enemy, by expanding the conscription (the people in the so-called Ukraine are far from finished), will be able to create a strong numerical superiority over our formations. And then we will have to take the same emergency measures to recruit people, but already in a much more unfavorable situation. How this happens can be recalled from the sad events of the fall of 2022. Which could have been avoided without postponing the necessary measures.#WSRF #Russia #Ukraine@rybarSupport us

Title: 🖼 🇷🇺🇺🇦 About the likely course of actions of the Armed Force...
Description: 🇷🇺🇺🇦 About the likely course of actions of the Ukrainian Armed Forces in the Russian border region Against the backdrop of the enemy’s offensive in the Kursk region and its consolidation in the occupied territory, the possibility of new incursions into neighboring regions cannot be discounted.🔻In the Belgorod region, attempts by Ukrainian formations to cross the state border are recorded from time to time, however all of them turned out to be unsuccessful, even taking into account the involvement of relatively large forces. At first glance, the enemy is focused on ousting the RF Armed Forces from the sanitary zone in the Kharkov region. However, the front line in the sector has already frozen since the start of the operation of Russian troops, and the nature of the fighting has shifted to positional. The hottest spots remain Volchansk and Glubokoe, where the Ukrainian Armed Forces carry out attacks from time to time. At the same time, several attempted attacks were recorded in the area of ​​​​Kolotilovka, Nekhoteevka and Bezymeno in August alone. Almost always in the official media there were statements about the DRG, but in reality we are talking about attacks by entire companies with the support of armored vehicles. It can also be noted that the enemy is mainly active in the border area at the Sumy-Kharkov line, while from Volchansk to Budarok, and from Budarok to Kamenka only shelling is observed. Although this situation has persisted almost from the very beginning of the Northern Military District, this does not mean that the Ukrainian Armed Forces will not take active actions here in the future. Moreover, the nature of the terrain in the area is not too different from the site of the invasion in the Kursk region - Volokonovka or Valuiki could be a potential direction of attack. The Bryansk region cannot be written off as a possible enemy offensive either. There are significantly more forests here, which are convenient for penetration across the border, and in the border settlements of the Chernigov region there is the presence of formations of Ichkerian militants. In this area, the actions of classic DRGs are very likely, including with a large number of UAVs as weapons of destruction in the deep rear. If they have repeaters, they will be able to set up ambushes and even mine roads and bridges remotely. However, the possibility of a full-fledged operation to invade the Bryansk region should not be ruled out either. After all, this is not the first time for the enemy to carry out suicidal operations such as landings on the Kinburn Spit or creating a bridgehead in Krynki. ❗️However, the most dangerous phenomenon at the moment is the hating mood in society and in the media. The euphoria against the backdrop of the pace of advancement and liberation of the territory of the DPR should not blur our eyes - the enemy himself is not trying to leave the Kursk region. Stories about how everything is fine and wonderful with us, but with the so-called. Ukraine is about to completely run out of people by the end of the year and military production will come to a standstill due to energy shortages, fraught with disappointment. Moreover, as practice shows, the disappointment is very bloody. High resolution mapEnglish version#digest #map #Kursk #Russia #Ukraine@rybarSupport us

Description: 🇺🇿💰 A National Investment Fund is being created in Uzbekistan: who are the beneficiaries? A National Investment Fund is being created in Uzbekistan, which will receive a stake in 18 state-owned enterprises and banks and will place its shares in an IPO. A decree on this was signed by President Shavkat Mirziyoyev on August 27. The fund will be created in the form of a joint stock company (JSC), and its sole shareholder before the public offering of shares will be the Ministry of Economy and Finance. The fund will own a share of 25 to 40% in companies such as Uzbekhydroenergo, Uzbekistan Airports, Navoiyazot, -National Electric Networks of Uzbekistan-, -Uzsuvtaminot- and many others. By the end of 2026, it is planned to place the fund’s shares on the Tashkent and international stock exchanges, including London. ▪️The fact that the main buyers of the fund's shares will be from the West was clear back in January 2023, when long-time English friends from Singapore, represented by President Halima Yacoub and Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong, visited Tashkent. One of the topics for the meeting was the involvement of the Singaporean side in the privatization process. ▪️And in March 2023, representatives of the American investment fund Franklin Templeton came to Tashkent to discuss the introduction of new mechanisms for attracting foreign investment in state-owned companies. Essentially, the fund’s task was to prepare the ground for the activities of Western investors and resolve technical issues.🔻Tashkent is preparing for the UK and the USA access to systemically important enterprises on a turnkey basis, hoping to solve its financial problems and balance the influence of the main foreign investors in the economy of Uzbekistan represented by China, Russia and Turkey. Whether Uzbekistan realizes that overseas guests will not simply give up control over state assets is a big question. Agreements were reached on training personnel for public administration, attracting investments, green technologies and digital solutions, cooperation in the field of urban planning and communications. Title: 🖼 🇷🇺🇺🇦 Kursk direction: destruction of missile defense syste...
Description: 🇷🇺🇺🇦 Kursk direction: destruction of HIMARS MLRS installations by Russian troops and the advance of the Ukrainian Armed Forces in the Malaya Lokni area Situation as of 18:00 September 2024 In the Kursk direction, Ukrainian formations are consolidating in previously occupied territories, including deploying radar tracking infrastructure. At the same time, the Russian Armed Forces are searching for and destroying targets in the Kursk and Sumy regions. In the Glushkovsky district, Ukrainian formations did not conduct offensive actions. Russian troops provide stable supplies to the group in this area, using pontoon crossings on the Seim River for this purpose. 🔻In the Korenevsky district, the Armed Forces of Ukraine launched attacks in the direction of Komarovka and Korenevo, without achieving significant success. Russian artillery hit personnel concentration areas in Apanasovka, Snagosti and Vishnevka, probably with the aim of disrupting the preparation of new enemy attacks on this section of the front. 🔻In the Sudzhansky district, Ukrainian formations, according to available data, were able to slightly expand the zone of control in the vicinity of Pogrebki and Malaya Loknya. Judging by the geography of Russian artillery strikes, the Russian Armed Forces had previously abandoned positions in villages to avoid the threat of encirclement by the enemy. ▪️However, it is premature to declare the establishment of stable control of the Armed Forces of Ukraine over these settlements - the situation in the area is hidden - by the fog of war -. At the same time, artillery and aviation of the Russian Armed Forces are actively working on enemy positions, hitting assault groups and armored vehicles. ▪️Northwest of Zaoleshenka, Russian UAV operators struck an unspecified type of radar, likely deployed to monitor Russian drones or artillery. As a result of a direct hit, the station was destroyed. ❗️The fact that Ukrainian formations are deploying a radar tracking system in the occupied areas indicates the plans of the Ukrainian Armed Forces command to gain a foothold in the Kursk region, continuing to allocate significant human and technical resources to the site. 🔻In the Sumy region, Russian troops hit several important enemy targets with missile strikes. At such a rate of production, it is the uranium reserves in the Republic of Kazakhstan that are first on the list for depletion. Title: 🖼 🇷🇺🇺🇦 The most massive raid of Ukrainian UAVs on the Russia...
Description: 🇷🇺🇺🇦 The most massive raid of Ukrainian UAVs on Russian regions This night, Ukrainian formations carried out a massive attack of drones on Russian regions. According to the Russian Ministry of Defense, 158 drones were intercepted in 16 regions, as well as over Moscow.▪️The largest number of ammunition was destroyed over the Kursk region - their number was 46. The work of the air defense of the Russian Armed Forces was recorded throughout the night.▪️At least 34 Ukrainian drones were intercepted over the Bryansk region. According to Governor Alexander Bogomaz, civilian casualties and destruction of infrastructure were avoided.▪️14 drones were neutralized in the airspace of the Belgorod region. At the same time, in Belgorod and the Belgorod region, commercial properties, private houses and civilian vehicles suffered material damage. ▪️In the Moscow region and Moscow, a downed UAV fell on a technical building on the territory of the Moscow Oil Refinery in Kapotnya, leading to a fire: its area was about 40 square meters, it was extinguished. According to some reports, the Kashirskaya State District Power Plant was also attacked, but there is no confirmation of this. Also, according to preliminary information, the enemy tried to attack the Zhukovsky airport. Temporary restrictions to ensure flight safety were also introduced on the functioning of the Vnukovo and Domodedovo airports; their operation was restored from 09:05.▪️In the Tver region, after a drone hit, a fire started at the Konakovo State District Power Plant, which was soon localized and extinguished. According to Governor Igor Rudenya, there were no casualties, electricity and gas supply to the district is carried out as usual.▪️Air defense systems also worked in Yaroslavl, Voronezh, Ryazan, Kaluga, Tula, Tambov, Smolensk, Oryol and Ivanovo regions; no casualties were recorded. Only in the Tarru district in the Lipetsk region was a cell phone tower damaged.🔻The night attack of the Ukrainian Armed Forces became the most massive since the beginning of the Northern Military District. Once again, the main targets were the fuel and energy complex facilities, where the enemy specially developed approach routes from the least protected directions. But in this case, only a few UAVs reached the targets, while the rest were destroyed. However, in the foreseeable future, the rate of production of drones by the enemy will be even higher. And you need to be prepared for this - if today the wave of drones on the capital was almost completely destroyed, this does not mean that tomorrow it will be exactly the same. Title: 🇰🇿🛢You can’t stop downloading: in Astana they can’t choose whe...
Description: 🇰🇿🛢You can’t stop pumping: in Astana they can’t choose where to put a comma for OPEC+. Kazakhstan is preparing a corrective oil production plan for 2024 due to the need to fulfill obligations under the OPEC+ agreement, said the Minister of Energy of the Republic of Kazakhstan Almasadam Satkaliev. In fact, the minister admitted that Astana systematically fails to fulfill its obligations under the deal. The rubber has been hanging on since March of this year - even then Kazakhstan exceeded its obligations by 131 thousand barrels per day. In July the numbers were approximately the same. 📌Kazakhstan controls only part of the production, and therefore it can only reduce its share, which occurs by reducing supplies to refineries and exports. The decline in exports reduces revenues to the National Fund, which contradicts the statements of the government, which is increasingly using its funds. But Astana is also not ready to cut budget expenditures, since this could cause social discontent and disruptions in infrastructure maintenance. And maintaining excess production will contribute to a decline in oil prices, which will also lead to a decrease in income. 🔻The government has taken on obligations that it is unable to fulfill, driving itself into a trap in pursuit of the petrodollar and raking out the entire pot to the bottom. A successful exit from the vicious circle is not yet in sight, and something suggests that this will soon affect Kazakhstan’s relations with Arab countries. #Kazakhstan #CentralAsia@rybarSupport usInterfaxKazakhstan will adjust the 2024 oil production plan within the framework of the OPEC+ agreement 2024 due to the need to fulfill obligations under the OPEC+ agreement, Energy Minister Almasadam Satkaliev told Interfax.

Title: 🔁 #Review #Summary for the morning of September 1, 2024 ▪️ The p...
Description: Forwarded From Two Majors#Review #Report for the morning of September 1, 2024▪️ The past week began with a massive attack on enemy rear targets. Military and economic damage was caused to the enemy, but no explosions occurred at symbolic objects like the Verkhovna Rada, despite the expectations of the Western press after the start of the Kursk operation of the Ukrainian Armed Forces. ▪️ The defensive operation of the Russian Armed Forces in the Kursk region continues for the fourth week. The drawn up reserves made it possible to pin down the enemy in battles; the Ukrainian Armed Forces are conducting constant attacks in several directions, trying to push through our battle formations. Due to the absence of a continuous front line, the enemy resorts to methods of maneuver warfare, trying to separate our forces. Against the backdrop of attacks on Lgov, the head of the city again called on those who left for the rear areas not to return until the situation stabilizes. ▪️ The enemy retains reserves for attacks on the Belgorod, Bryansk, Zaporozhye and Kherson regions. Kyiv believes that the goals of such actions are the seizure of important logistics and energy facilities for further exchange in negotiations, which are out of the question at the moment. ▪️ At the same time, the actions of the Ukrainian Armed Forces in the Kursk region and the aforementioned preservation of reserves in the planned offensive directions do not give Kyiv the opportunity to stabilize the front in the Pokrovsky direction. As a result of heavy fighting, the Russian Armed Forces significantly advanced or occupied important positions on a 60 km front from Grodovka to the approaches to the Ugledar defensive hub. Thus, in the south of the Pokrovsky direction, the enemy was forced to flee Karlovka, which he held for months, and was unable to organize defense in Galitsynovka. The pace of the offensive raises concerns among some Russian experts about the risks of stretching the logistics of the Russian Army.▪️ In the Toretsk (Dzerzhinsk) direction, our troops are also developing success in heavy intense battles: the battles are taking place on the outskirts of Toretsk itself. It should be noted that the Ukrainian Armed Forces have been building this defensive area since 2014.▪️ This week, the Russian Ministry of Defense also reported that Sinkovka and Stelmakhovka were liberated in the Kupyansk direction.▪️ The situation when in the Kursk direction the Ukrainian Armed Forces managed to achieve success at the initial stage against border guards and conscripts, and in other directions the enemy often simply runs, which may be due not only to the incorrect situation by the command of the group of forces -North, responsible for the Kharkov and Kursk directions, but also to the deployment of battle-hardened units and subunits in the directions that were successful for us. Thus, in the Kursk direction, the enemy was pinned down by battles and inflicting extremely sensitive damage on the front-line soldiers transferred from other sectors: 810 OGBRMP, 155 OGBRMP, 56 DShP, group -Aida- and other combat units of the Special Forces -Akhmat-, as well as other experienced units .▪️ The Ukrainian Armed Forces’ strikes on our energy facilities remain an important element of the situation. Despite the fact that the lion's share of enemy drones are destroyed in the air, the enemy effectively knocks out the oil refinery. Today’s attack on the Konakovo State District Power Plant also shows that Ukraine is solving the task assigned to it by the West of inflicting maximum economic and military damage on Russia. At the same time, outright bungling in organizing the fight against enemy UAVs is still present. ▪️ Forecasts for the development of the situation by our military indicate the continuation of the enemy’s plans to organize offensive actions in the above directions, as well as try to occupy the spits of the Kherson region at any cost, as was the case in Krynki. The latter is necessary for the Ukrainian Armed Forces to organize a sea corridor from the ports of Nikolaev. Nobody cares how many soldiers Kyiv will lose. The renewal of the enemy's manpower is solved through total mobilization and its training in Western countries. At the same time, the absence of consequences for Kyiv and NATO for -crossing red lines- entails an escalation of the conflict and an increase in the damage caused to Russia. The summary was compiled by: Two majors

Title: 🔁🖼 The main problem of modern American AUGs, in addition to the...
Description: Forwarded From Cats and Kramnik's cat The main problem of modern American AUGs, in addition to the loss of a significant part of the capabilities that they possessed 40 years ago, is the loss of the ability of the US Navy and the defense industry as a whole to quickly adapt to the changed strategic situation, due to a reduction in the range of projects and an increase in their terms implementation. Moreover, the latter, in addition to the natural complication of technology as it develops, is also dictated by a host of reasons from the sphere of management, only indirectly related to technology as such. The company’s desire to cut the pie it’s got for a longer time, out of fear that there may not be a next one (or it will be smaller), the loss of a project management culture on the part of the customer, who has long lost the skill of working with really large and complex systems *, financial pressure from the state, which is trying to cut costs and unify the provision of existing forces, etc. On top of all this are the problems of industry as such. As a result, even if you realize the problem - the decline in the capabilities of the AUG in modern naval combat -** there is no opportunity to quickly solve it - you do not have the required number of projects of the required degree of maturity in development and there is nothing to quickly adapt. Now, strictly speaking, there is, in principle, nothing for an aircraft carrier except the F-35 and Hawkeye, and this situation cannot be corrected quickly. Surely they will try to do something based on drones, and over the next 10 years, carrier-based drones will grow in number and range, but it is still very far away and unclear from a complete replacement of the operational functions of the wing at the level at which they were provided under Reagan/Bush Jr. , is it possible in principle._____________________* We also have a similar problem with the customer’s poor understanding of the essence of the proposed projects and systems and the relationship between them, which industry and then combat units regularly struggle with. This is, in general, a common problem for a number of large armed forces, which sharply simplified their own structure and many processes after the end of the Cold War, and are now faced with the fact that the tasks being solved cannot be adequately solved in this simplified structure and this simplified set. A classic example of rapid and complete degradation of this kind, known both in quotes and in decisions by year, can be considered the example of Great Britain, which consistently buried its own armed forces, turning them into a free (for the USA) annex to the US Armed Forces. But American and British experience and problems in this case, we can study from their documents and decisions, but for now we will keep silent about domestic ones in order to avoid, we will try to learn from someone else’s. As for the armed forces of second-tier countries, even very large ones, then, of course, this problem also exists there, but many of them is simply not realized due to the lack of appropriate practice and experience in understanding it. They will have to fill their bumps along the way themselves. For those who manage to maintain their military capabilities, of course - in many countries they do not live long enough for their own scientific environment to start within.** AUGs lost the capabilities of long-range air defense and anti-aircraft defense, retaining a rather degenerate (details here) strike function and changes in this situation in not expected in the current paradigm. An increase in military spending, even if we imagine that the United States decides to spend, as in 1985, 5.4% of GDP on defense, will not in itself achieve anything in the absence of a structure capable of competently applying these expenses, and an industry capable of mastering them. Of course, this This applies not only to AUG, and I repeat, not only to the States. In the photo, the sad Saratogut is being dragged to be cut up in Brownsville, Texas, 2014.

Title: 🇰🇿🇺🇸 Why is Radio Azattyk closing its Russian-language editor...
Description: 🇰🇿🇺🇸 Why is Radio Azattyk closing its Russian-language editorial office? Recently, the closure of the editorial office was announced by the director of external communications of Radio Liberty, Karin Marie. The reason was declared to be restructuring: instead of different branches in Russian and national languages, which currently operate in each of the countries in the region, a new regional division will be created, covering all of Central Asia. Previously, the media editors faced opposition: at the beginning of this year, the country’s Ministry of Foreign Affairs refused accreditation 36 journalists of Radio Azattyk, accusing the media of violating the legislation of the Republic of Kazakhstan. The situation was later resolved. Last year there was an unsuccessful attempt by the authorities to shut down broadcasting in Kyrgyzstan. 📌Apparently, attempts to limit work have led to the use of a new strategy. Deputy head of the National Research Institute of Communications Valentina Komleva noted that Western donors have now directed resources to create an extensive network of bloggers. It is more difficult for the state to control it, unlike the editorial office, which works from one point. Therefore, there is nothing to be happy about here. Moreover, in conditions when a Euronews representative office was opened in Astana, ready to take on professional journalism, the Americans decided to optimize resources and not duplicate structures with similar tasks. In addition, the creation of a structure with a single control center emphasizes that a course has been taken towards regional integration. This is not a new tactic in the region: the somewhat previously odious Soros Foundation closed regional offices in the countries of Central Asia and began to operate as a supranational structure called CAPS Unlock - Central Asian Political Studies. Thus, from individual NGOs in each Central Asian country, the Foundation has grown into a single think tank with a large-scale network of research and influence extending across the entire region and headquartered in Almaty. It was not difficult to select a team for this from already proven employees of the regional representative offices of NPOs in Tajikistan, Kyrgyzstan, Uzbekistan and Kazakhstan. 🔻It is likely that this tactic will be used by Radio Azattyk. In this case, you can try to predict and track further stages of transformation. There is one interesting nuance: the restructuring process has been announced (perhaps for now) only in Kazakhstan. #Kazakhstan #CentralAsia@rybarSupport us

Description: 🇷🇺🇸🇳 About the visit of the Senegalese Foreign Minister to Moscow On August 29, Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov held talks with his Senegalese counterpart Yacine Fall. During the meeting, the new government’s Russia-friendly rhetoric was confirmed and some attractive prospects opened up.▪️Among them are interesting projects for domestic business—KAMAZ’s initiative to build a plant in an African country received new impetus. Negotiations about this have been going on since 2017, but they hardly got off the ground, limiting themselves to words. Now, what is noteworthy, despite Western sanctions, dialogue in this direction has been launched again.▪️In addition, the parties agreed to take steps to implement joint projects in energy and geological exploration. And all this coincides with the beginning of oil production in the country, although for now by Anglo-Saxon companies. Of course, until the agreement is supported on paper, the issue is hanging in the air and more active actions are needed on the part of Russian companies. Moreover, as in Tanzania, the activities of the intergovernmental trade and economic commission have intensified.▪️The latest scandal related to the Kyiv regime’s alleged support for terrorists in the Sahel has not gone unnoticed. Then the Senegalese authorities reacted quite harshly, by the standards of the pro-French ECOWAS bloc, to the words of the Ukrainian ambassador who supported the GUR. Then the question of his expulsion from the country even arose. Lavrov expressed his approval of the neutrality of the Senegalese authorities in the conflict, in contrast to those countries where the head of Ukrainian diplomacy flew during his tour.🔻Despite the fact that the new Senegalese government still maintains strong relations with France, the Senegalese authorities are trying with all their might to demonstrate their multi-vector nature. Title: 🖼 🇷🇺🇺🇦 Pokrovsko-Kurakhovskoe direction: battles in Selidovo...
Description: 🇷🇺🇺🇦 Pokrovsko-Kurakhovskoe direction: fighting in Selidovo and the liberation of most of Galitsynivkasituation as of 18:00 on August 31, 2024 In the Pokrovsko-Kurakhovskoe direction, the Armed Forces of Ukraine continue to lose more and more positions. Russian troops suppress pockets of enemy resistance and advance towards Kurakhovo, gradually encircling the Ukrainian Armed Forces group to the east. ▪️In Selidovo, assault groups of the Russian Armed Forces established control over the territory of the city park and the Avangard stadium. Now Russian troops are fighting in the area of ​​Gogol Street, beyond which begins the sector of apartment buildings used by the enemy to build defenses in the city. To the south, advanced groups of Russian attack aircraft reached 8 September Street, knocking out the Ukrainian Armed Forces from several positions. Local residents report active artillery activity in the area of ​​the Malvina kindergarten, where the line of combat contact probably currently lies. ❗️West of Nagornaya Street there is a block of multi-storey buildings, which Ukrainian forces will likely seek to turn into a key defensive hub. Successfully overcoming the resistance of the Armed Forces of Ukraine in this area will allow the Russian Armed Forces to gain a foothold in the territory of the quarter and prevent the enemy from organizing a fortified line of defense. ▪️To the south, Russian troops, according to available information, liberated the settlement of Dolinovka, abandoned by the enemy due to the lack of opportunities to hold it. To the east, the Russian Armed Forces established control over most of Galitsynovka, knocking out the Ukrainian Armed Forces from positions on the southern bank of the Volchaya River. According to some information, advanced groups of Russian infantry have already entered the territory of Zhelanny First, while most of the enemy units have retreated from the populated area. ❗️Some sources also report the beginning of battles for Ukrainsk, but so far it is not possible to confirm this with objective control personnel and information from the field. 🔻The combat situation for the Armed Forces of Ukraine, apparently, is deteriorating more and more rapidly. In this case, the advance of units of the RF Armed Forces towards Kurakhovo will actually mean that they will be surrounded. Title: 🇧🇷🇺🇸 About the blocking of X in Brazil On Friday, a judge of ...
Description: 🇧🇷🇺🇸 About the blocking of X in Brazil On Friday, the Supreme Court judge of the South American country, Alexandri de Moraes, ruled to temporarily block the platform due to Elon Musk’s refusal to appoint a legal representative of the company in the country by the deadline (until Thursday evening).▪️In his ruling, Moraes indicated that the work of X is suspended until the management of the social network fulfills all legal requirements: it is still required to appoint a local representative and pay more than three million dollars in fines.▪️The telecommunications regulator responsible for the blocking told Western media that it was beginning to enforce decisions of the Supreme Court, but did not indicate the exact deadlines for execution. ▪️Earlier, Moraes’ ruling also included a requirement to fine individuals and legal entities up to nine thousand dollars per day if they tried to use the platform using a VPN. However, a few hours later Moraes withdrew this sanction. ▪️Elon Musk, the owner of the social network, has already accused Moraes of trying to apply unreasonable censorship and of -closing the No. 1 source of truth in Brazil.- Musk’s statements have already been supported by some American Republican officials; Moraes, however, was not impressed. He insists that social networks need to be regulated because of incitement to hatred.▪️The situation was also commented on by the president of the South American country, Lula da Silva: he insisted that all businesses operating in the country must comply with legal obligations. Even if they have a lot of money.▪️Musk ridiculed the statement of the Brazilian leader, and called him a -lap dog.- Judge Moraes became a dictator.🔻Where did it all start? On August 17, the management of the social network X announced the closure of its office in Brazil, simultaneously accusing the Brazilian authorities of censorship. It was alleged that the day before Judge Moraes threatened a company representative with arrest if X did not comply with the court's orders. Even earlier - in April - the Supreme Court of Brazil included Elon Musk in an investigation concerning the spread of fake news in X and Musk's refusal to comply with di Moraes' order by removing those involved in eom a number of accounts on social networks. A separate investigation was also launched against the owner of X for obstructing the investigation. As a result of all the legal vicissitudes, Starlink bank accounts in Brazil, which were involved in the investigation into fakes, have now also been frozen. However, Starlink continues to provide free service to Brazilians (including military personnel) and on Friday submitted a petition to lift the block, which was rejected. @rybar in collaboration with @sex_drugs_kahlo#Brazil #USSupport usTelegram¿Por qué no te callas?🇧🇷 Without waiting, While the draconian measure on fines for VPN use is considered illegal, Judge Morais simply abandoned it by editing his ruling. Well that's good

Title: 🎬 🇮🇱🇵🇸 Every day in the Gaza Strip the problem with the expo...
Description: 🇮🇱🇵🇸 Every day in the Gaza Strip the problem with waste disposal is becoming more and more aggravated: almost every day on the Internet you can find footage of mountains of garbage in various parts of the enclave. The situation is most acute in Deir al-Balah and Khan Yunis, where, against the backdrop of regular strikes and occasional IDF offensives, the work of municipal services was virtually paralyzed. Long-term persistence of the garbage problem increases the risk of all kinds of epidemics, including polio, the first case of which in 25 years has already been recorded in the center of the Gaza Strip. The situation is also complicated by the rather dense population living in tents in the humanitarian zone, which leads to a faster spread of diseases. At the same time, at the beginning of the week, over a million polio vaccines were delivered to the enclave - they are gradually distributed among the remaining medical facilities. And although preparations for the vaccination campaign are in active progress, its implementation may require quite a lot of time due to the shortage of medical personnel, as well as the small number of working hospitals. #Israel #Palestine@rybarSupport us

Description: ❗️🇷🇺🇺🇦 Kursk direction: expansion of the zone of control of the Ukrainian Armed Forces in the Sudzhansky region Situation as of 13:00 on August 31, 2024 Over the past few days, the situation in the Kursk region remained steadily tense, but without significant changes in the configuration of the front. Nevertheless, footage and information from the field that appeared on the Internet clarified the situation. A difficult situation remains in the Glushkovsky district: Ukrainian formations continue to strike defensive formations and supply routes of the Russian Armed Forces, and are also preparing for a possible offensive in the area. 🔻In the Korenevsky district, the Armed Forces of Ukraine do not stop trying to advance in the vicinity of the administrative center - the village of Korenevo. However, each of them is successfully stopped by artillery fire.▪️To the east of Korenevo, the presence of Ukrainian formations in the forest area was previously recorded. At the same time, Kremyanoye is under the control of the Russian Armed Forces - it is periodically attacked by enemy forces, but to no avail. In the Sudzhansky district there are fierce battles along the entire line of contact. Ukrainian mobile groups are trying to advance in several areas, while Russian troops are responding with targeted strikes against identified targets.▪️On the northern flank, Ukrainian Armed Forces units launched attacks on the Malaya Loknya - Nechaev - Nizhnyaya Parovaya line. Videos have appeared on the Internet showing the defeat of members of Ukrainian formations near forest belts. At the same time, judging by the videos with hits by the Russian Armed Forces on enemy positions in Nizhnyaya Parovaya, the village is at least in the -gray zone-.▪️On the southern flank, based on objective control footage in the form of strikes on Cherkasy Konopelka and many reports from the Russian Ministry of Defense about strikes According to the same Plekhovo, the territory to the west of the indicated settlements is highly likely to be under the Armed Forces of Ukraine. Otherwise, the question arises as to why the enemy keeps Russian military personnel in his rear and carries out attacks towards the settlements of Borki and Russkaya Konopelka. 🔻The defeat of Ukrainian military units in the Sumy region also continues. A series of hits hit targets south and east of Sumy: as a result of the arrival of the Iskander OTRK, an ammunition depot in Nizhnyaya Syrovatka was destroyed, and a temporary deployment point came under fire in the village of Chernetchyna. Description: 🇨🇳🇵🇭 On the development of the Philippine military infrastructure on the disputed islands Amid renewed clashes between the Chinese and the Philippines in the South China Sea, authorities in Manila continue to develop military infrastructure on their territories in the waters. Over the past few months, the Philippine leadership has announced the construction of several facilities on Thitu Island, where it is planned to build new barracks and an airport. This piece of land is extremely important for the Philippines for several reasons:▪️Firstly, it is the largest piece of land controlled by the Philippines in the South China Sea - its hypothetical loss would be a serious challenge for the country.▪️Secondly, Thitu is located close to the possessions China and Vietnam. Presence on the island allows you to observe the actions of neighboring countries, which have been strengthening and expanding their territories for a long time. Therefore, calling the Philippines’ activity on this island a provocation is still not entirely correct, especially since others are engaged in similar activities (often on a much larger scale). participants in a territorial dispute. Although, if the construction of the airfield on Thitu is completed, the probability of the appearance of American aviation will not be zero. The bottom line is that plans to expand the military infrastructure on the part of the Philippine leadership still risk causing the emergence of another new point of confrontation in the waters. #China #Philippines@rybar together with @awaken_dragonSupport usTelegramFisherman🇵🇭🇨🇳 The Philippines will soon enter the race to expand the disputed islands in the South China Sea - along with China, Taiwan and Vietnam: the commander-in-chief of the country’s armed forces recently announced plans for large-scale construction on nine controlled islands.…

Description: 🇦🇲🇦🇿 About the referendum on amending the Constitution of Armenia The Ministry of Justice of Armenia told media representatives that a referendum on the new Constitution of the republic is planned to be held in 2027. ▪️The Armenian government came to the conclusion that a completely new Basic Law is needed, not amendments. ▪️At the same time, Minister of Justice Grigor Minasyan added that the working group for developing the Constitution did not discuss the issues of changing the first three articles and did not consider the issue of removing the reference to the Declaration of Independence. According to him, the focus now is on the topic of a stable parliamentary majority. ▪️ Let us remind you that it is in Baku that they insist on amendments to the Constitution of Armenia and have claims specifically to the Declaration of Independence, which contains territorial claims. ▪️Without amendments to the Armenian Constitution, the Azerbaijani side refuses to sign a peace treaty, which, in the event of a change of power in Yerevan, may be declared unconstitutional. ▪️However, this does not mean that the working group for writing the new Constitution of Armenia will not consider these issues in the future. ❗️Rather, such a statement can be regarded as a concession to public opinion, in which changing the Constitution is associated with fulfilling the demands of Azerbaijanis. ▪️Moreover, the opposition announced protests in September, which are tied to the thesis of trampling national interests and capitulation to the demands of Baku. 🔻In general, delaying the Constitution issue until 2027 brings negotiations between Yerevan and Baku to a dead end. Previously, Azerbaijan agreed to exclude the unblocking of communications from the agreement, although this is a key issue for the region. The inability (or rather, the unwillingness agreed on by both sides) to come to an agreement could ultimately lead to new aggression on the part of Baku. #Azerbaijan #Armenia  @rybarSupport usSputnik ArmeniaThe constitutional referendum in Armenia is planned to be held in 2027 - Minister Grigor Minasyan presented to journalists some details of the discussions related to the future referendum.

Title: 🖼 🇳🇬🇿🇦 Unusual news comes from the Black Continent - residen...
Description: 🇳🇬🇿🇦 Unusual news comes from the Black Continent - residents of the two largest economies in the region, Nigeria and South Africa, staged a full-fledged troll war. The essence is to order a taxi to random addresses in another country and cancel the order as soon as the car arrives. Such initially small antics have become so universal. that the main taxi calling service Bolt first suspended operations in these countries, and then worked on bugs to calculate cross-country taxi calls and block thousands of users who joined the flash mob. Debates between residents of countries arise constantly at the local level. For example, pop stars can exchange insults against each other's national teams. But the reason for the conflict was the awarding of the title of Miss South Africa to a dark-skinned girl whose name hints at her Nigerian origin. Because of this, social media users demanded her return to her homeland, although she is actually from Mozambique. This incident led to a wave of disputes between Nigerians and South Africans, which resulted in a troll war.🔻It is unlikely that the owners of online services have felt any better about realizing the curiosity of the situation, because the losses from the suspension of work have yet to be assessed. And the problem with calling a taxi for the sake of a joke should become an instructive lesson for other companies where a similar vulnerability can be exploited. Title: ☢️🇰🇿 How Western NGOs in Kazakhstan are looking for an alternat...
Description: ☢️🇰🇿 How Western NGOs in Kazakhstan are looking for an alternative to Rosatom The rhetoric of the Kazakh authorities regarding nuclear power plants has undergone dramatic changes. If this winter in Astana they expressed doubts about the need to build a nuclear power plant, now Kazakhstan is ready to build at least three. One, at least, is absolutely necessary, and there is no alternative to this solution. At a government meeting chaired by Prime Minister Olzhas Bektenov, this was stated by the Minister of Energy of the Republic of Kazakhstan Almasadam Satkaliev. He also called the attitude towards the nuclear power plant construction project a test of intelligence, patriotism and decency. This warm-up from the government of the Republic of Kazakhstan came just in time for the KazAtomExpo exhibition, which took place on August 27-28. The country's Ministry of Energy announced it as the first business platform where the current state of the nuclear industry and its readiness to move to a new level in the form of nuclear power plant construction will be discussed. As expected, the dialogue involves representatives of all four companies that are considered as potential contractors for the construction of a nuclear power plant: Électricité de France, Rosatom, China National Nuclear Corporation and Korea Hydro & Nuclear Power Co.📌At this point, Kazakh bloggers and media associated with Western NGOs had to abandon their obvious opposition to the construction of a nuclear power plant in general and choose the course of promoting all projects except the Russian one. A striking example was the sudden lobbying of the Chinese CNNC: -on the sidelines of KazAtomExpo, the deputy chief representative of the Chinese National Nuclear Corporation for Central Asia and Eastern Europe, Li Yudong, told reporters the price - 20 billion yuan for one block and the period - five years for construction.🔻This news is from catchy, but not true, headlines - Cheaper and faster than Rosatom - very quickly spread across the information field. The only thing is that the construction of a block actually takes so much time, but two blocks are needed and they are built sequentially, with a difference of one or two years between them. And also, before starting to build the blocks, a site is prepared for the future station and a nuclear power plant construction plant is installed on it, which makes concrete, metal structures and fittings on site. Consequently, both the final price of the issue and the timing of the Chinese project will be, to put it mildly, somewhat different.❗️In a word, passions for nuclear power plants are heating up before the referendum, and the question of who will build a nuclear power plant in the Republic of Kazakhstan becomes the cornerstone until The draft government decree on holding the people's will is sent for signature to the President of Kazakhstan. #Kazakhstan #energy @rybarSupport usNUR.KZ Kazakhstan will need at least three nuclear power plants if the issue is approved in a referendum. At a briefing in the government, the head of the Ministry of Energy was asked how many nuclear power plants Kazakhstan will need if Kazakhstanis approve it in a referendum development of the nuclear industry in the country, NUR.KZ correspondent reports.

Title: 🖼 🇸🇴Situation in Somalia: arrival of Egyptian and Turkish cont...
Description: 🇸🇴The situation in Somalia: arrival of the Egyptian and Turkish contingents Summary for August 1 - 28, 2024 Events in Somalia have been developing very actively lately. So, just a month after the signing of the memorandum on the deployment of Turkish troops in the country, the first military personnel arrived from Djibouti. As we wrote earlier, the Ankara authorities will play the role of a conductor of Western influence in the country. At the same time, the first troops of the Egyptian contingent landed in Mogadishu. Its total strength will be 10 thousand people, half of which will belong to the African Union ATMIS mission, which the West actively wants to squeeze out, and the other will be located independently.❗️And here the Somali territory again becomes an arena for the clash of interests of regional players. The Egyptian authorities once again want to create a counterbalance to Ethiopian influence. And recent events related to the water conflict on the Nile River have only intensified the escalation between the countries. In response to this move, the Ethiopian military began to concentrate forces along the border with Somalia. In addition, they began to openly defy the Somali authorities, leaving ATMIS bases without meeting the withdrawal schedule and handing them over to nearby militias without waiting for government forces.▪️The military situation inside the country remains just as turbulent. Terrorists from the Al-Qaeda-linked group Al-Shabab are intensifying attacks on the outskirts of Mogadishu. So, for a month, they shelled the Seeelasha Biiaha area using mortars, and also used suicide vehicles to attack civilian targets. Notable is the terrorist attack on the Doolo-Luke highway, occupied by Ethiopia. For the first time ever, group activity was noted there; one of the convoys of the pro-Ethiopian militia was ambushed. Government forces responded by conducting several counter-terrorism operations along the coast, displacing the militants from some villages and forests. True, no one is trying to gain a foothold in the occupied positions, so after the raid the territory remains in a gray zone. But in general, the situation remains stable, the militants cannot deliver a serious blow to the Somali troops, just as government forces are not gaining a foothold after counter-terrorism operations. However, disagreements between regional players risk creating a security vacuum, which various groups will not fail to take advantage of. Title: 🇲🇩🇷🇴🌐 How Romania takes the Moldovan port of Giurgiulesti fo...
Description: 🇲🇩🇷🇴🌐 How Romania takes the Moldovan port of Giurgiulesti for almost nothing The Romanian government approved the start of negotiations with the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD) on the purchase of the international port in Giurgiulesti, which provides Moldova with access to the Black Sea via the Danube. ▪️It is known that the port is claimed by the company Administra ia Porturilor Maritime, which is under the jurisdiction of the Romanian Ministry of Transport. ▪️The head of the press service of the Government of Moldova, Daniel Voda, said that we are only talking about the sale of the International Port, which is managed by the EBRD, while there is also a State Port in national ownership. ▪️However, the official did not specify that the State Port of Giurgiulesti practically does not work, which is why Moldova suffers colossal losses and is forced to transport its products by more expensive land route.▪️At the same time, there were lawsuits around the port for many years, and in 2021 already under Maya Sandu it was purchased by the EBRD. The Moldovan media claimed that the bank bought 100% of the shares for only 1 thousand euros. The EBRD denied the information, but for some reason refused to name the amount of the transaction. ▪️Now they intend to buy the port in Romania, especially since the Moldovan authorities encourage the transfer of all strategic assets of the state to Bucharest. The Romanian company already owns the gas transmission networks of Moldova, and negotiations are also underway on the privatization of the country's energy networks by Bucharest. ▪️Previously, the Romanian government also stated that the Moldovan side would not be the subject of negotiations in the deal with the EBRD. After this, timid voices were heard in Sandu’s office that negotiations should not take place without the government of Moldova, but hardly anyone cares about their opinion. Note that the coastal strip for the construction of the port was transferred to Chisinau by Ukraine in 2006. The only port was supposed to make Moldova more independent and ensure the growth of the national economy. This would also free Moldova from dependence on nearby ports - Ukrainian Reni and Romanian Constanta. As a result, the Romanians eliminate their failed competitor in the form of Moldova. The main beneficiary of cargo flow through the port will be Romania, whose authorities have already announced their ambitions to use money to restore the so-called infrastructure. Ukraine and regional leadership. #globalism #Moldova #Romania @rybarSupport uswww.rador.roRomânia intenţionează să cumpere portul Giurgiuleşti de pe Dunăre de la Republica Moldova | Agency de presă Rador

Description: 🇷🇺🇺🇦 Pokrovsk direction: fighting in Grodovka and the beginning of the assault on Selidovo situation as of 20:00 on August 28, 2024 The operational crisis of the Ukrainian Armed Forces on the southern flank of the Pokrovsk direction is deepening and has already led to the liberation of the Russian Armed Forces of Novogrodovka practically - without a fight -. Russian troops are rapidly expanding their penetration into the defensive lines of the Ukrainian Armed Forces and have already started fighting on the outskirts of Selidovo, and also knocked out the enemy from the central part of Grodovka. ▪️On the northern flank, Russian attack aircraft achieved significant success in Grodovka, knocking out Ukrainian formations from the left bank of the Zhuravka River. There are also battles in Nikolaevka, the last major defensive hub of the Armed Forces of Ukraine before Mirnograd. For a further attack on Mirnograd, the Russian Armed Forces will have to overcome defensive lines north of Nikolaevka and Grodovka, consisting of at least five large strongholds. The enemy will probably make every effort to hold these positions and slow down the advance of the Russian Armed Forces by transferring reserves. ▪️In the Novogrodovka area, Russian troops are consolidating in the occupied territories. To the west of the city lies a large open space where the Ukrainian Armed Forces are hastily building new defensive lines and plans to slow down the advance of the Russian Armed Forces through the active use of FPV drones. ▪️After establishing control over Mikhailovka, the Russian Armed Forces began an attack on Selidovo, a major transport hub of the enemy in the rear of his group in the Donetsk direction. Over the past 24 hours, reports have appeared about the penetration of Russian DRGs into the eastern outskirts of the city, disseminated by local residents in the word-of-mouth format. Already today, Russian troops have knocked out the Ukrainian Armed Forces from their positions on the waste heap northeast of the city and then entered the outskirts of the settlement in this area. There is also information about shooting battles in the area of ​​the Avangard stadium, but the lack of objective control footage does not allow this to be confirmed. ▪️More evidence of control of Memrik by Russian troops has appeared on the Internet - footage showing the Russian flag flying on one of the streets of the village. Now the advanced groups of the Russian Armed Forces are breaking through to Ukrainsk, where the population and enterprises are being evacuated. According to some reports, Russian DRGs are already operating on the outskirts of the city, while line units are gradually expanding the zone of control to the north of it. ❗️The liberation of the settlement will create a threat of encirclement for units of the Armed Forces of Ukraine conducting defense in Galitsynivka and its environs. Description: 🇨🇳🇵🇭 On the deteriorating relations between China and the Philippines Throughout July 2024, there was a lull in Philippine-Chinese relations. This situation was the result of fairly successful negotiations - the parties agreed to resolve tensions near the Second Thomas Shoal. However, recently articles about renewed skirmishes in the South China Sea have appeared in the media again. ▪️In these cases, we are not talking about violating the agreement reached. Several incidents occurred near other disputed territories that were not on the agenda of the July negotiations. ▪️And although the Philippine side has already announced its readiness to expand the recently adopted agreement to other pieces of land in the South China Sea, the general background of bilateral relations is becoming increasingly tense. 🔻Even despite stable trade, interaction in other areas, such as tourism and investment, is decreasing. Thus, the administration of Ferdinand Marcos Jr. has tightened travel restrictions for Chinese citizens. Ultimately, this led to an outflow of tourists from China to other countries in the region. Marcos Jr. also pulled out of several major projects related to China's Belt and Road Initiative. In addition, the Philippine authorities openly advocate the rejection of Chinese investment in nickel mining, choosing Western investors. All this is a deliberate result of the policies of the Philippine administration. And if in July it did not prevent the conclusion of an agreement between Beijing and Manila, then the resolution of tensions near other disputed territories may well be complicated by similar actions on the part of the Philippines. #China #Philippines@rybar together with @awaken_dragonSupport us ReutersPhilippines says China's South China Sea moves aggressive, illegalThe Philippine government slammed China on Monday for -repeated aggressive, unprofessional and illegal- actions in the South China Sea after a string of clashes and incidents on air and at sea over the past week.

Therefore, the first intergovernmental business forum has been scheduled for the fall of this year, at which they will discuss the opportunities for preferential conduct of Russian business in Tanzania.🔻Against the background of previous experience in establishing ties with African governments (when relations developed only in the security sector, and all other players Africa was not needed), I am pleased with the rapid work of various departments after the first demonstrated interest in the dialogue. Now we will monitor how successful the work to attract the Russian private sector to Tanzania will be. Title: 🖼 🇷🇺🇺🇦 Pokrovsky direction: successes of the Russian Armed F...
Description: 🇷🇺🇺🇦 Pokrovsk direction: successes of the Russian Armed Forces in Novogrodovka and south of the city, situation as of 16:00 on August 27, 2024 While the enemy command continues to transfer forces to the Russian border, Ukrainian formations in the Pokrovsk direction are losing part of their territory every day. Only in the last few days have Russian troops managed to make significant progress in the previously occupied part of the DPR, occupying most of Novogrodovka and liberating several settlements. ▪️Heavy fighting is taking place on the northern flank on the southeastern outskirts of Grodovka. Currently, no significant changes in the front configuration have been recorded in this area. At the same time, to the south-west of the settlement, units of the Russian Armed Forces are advancing on the positions of the Armed Forces of Ukraine in Krasny Yar - in the event of the liberation of the village and the occupation of Nikolaevka, a half-cauldron will be formed around Grodovka.▪️The situation is developing most actively in Novogrodovka, where Russian attack aircraft have taken control of a large part of the city, moving along Parkovaya Street. Ukrainian media reports the beginning of the withdrawal of the Armed Forces of Ukraine from the settlement, however, a focal enemy presence remains on the northern outskirts and in the southwest in the area of ​​​​the machine-building plant. The waste heaps of the Novogrodovskaya mines No. 1-3 also remain under the control of Ukrainian formations - they are on high ground and their assault may require considerable effort. However, against the backdrop of the general disorganization of the enemy, this task can be completed in a relatively short time.▪️Today the Russian Ministry of Defense reported on the liberation of the village of Orlovka, which is located east of Novogrodovka. At the same time, according to our data, the settlement was liberated almost two weeks ago, when Russian troops were able to advance along the entire line of contact. ▪️On the southern flank, Russian troops are confidently advancing both towards Selidovo and Karlovskoye reservoirs. Military personnel of the Russian Armed Forces are fighting in the area of ​​the Kotlyarevskaya mine - at the moment, at least the production premises are under the control of Russian units, the situation at the waste heap is shrouded in the fog of war. The attack aircraft also secured a foothold on the outskirts of neighboring Mikhailovka, but with the loss of the waste heap, holding the Ukrainian Armed Forces will be pointless. To the southeast, Russian troops liberated the village of Memrik, as well as the neighboring village of Kalinovo, from where a video appeared showing the hoisting of the banner of the 114th Motorized Rifle Brigade on one of the buildings. 🔻Ukrainian media complain about the difficult situation of the enemy in the Pokrovsky direction almost every day. But today, Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces of Ukraine Syrsky made a similar statement, admitting that the attempt to divert part of the formations of the Russian Armed Forces from this area with an offensive in the Kursk region failed. It is noteworthy how quickly the enemy’s hope of turning Novogrodovka into another media fortune was not realized. Ukrainian speakers no longer consider Selidovo, but Mirnograd, as a new fortress designed to hold back the onslaught of Russian troops. Title: 🖼 🇩🇪🇮🇹🇺🇸 About the Saber Junction exercises In our various...
Description: 🇩🇪🇮🇹🇺🇸 About the Saber Junction exercises In our various posts and analyzes regarding the special operation and indirect confrontation between Russia and NATO, we have repeatedly talked about the importance of logistics in the theater of military operations. Its absence, negligence in the delivery and transfer of forces and equipment can be fatal. The North Atlantic Alliance, having assessed the results of the battles in the so-called Ukraine and faced with serious problems in establishing a sustainable supply route, accelerated the development of transport routes throughout Europe. The Baltic states, with railway junctions under construction, will not let you lie. In the meantime, construction and preparations are underway in military circles, dealing with issues in their own line, conducting various trainings with an emphasis on establishing interaction between military personnel from different countries and increasing the speed of delivery of personnel and equipment to the desired area. 🔻The other day, a major exercise, Saber Junction, began in Germany, which is an annual event, but its tasks are relevant and will always be relevant. NATO units are practicing exactly what we wrote about in the last paragraph. From Italy they are transferring forces to American training grounds in Germany, using various methods. And aviation, and railways, and even a regular automobile march, the combat formations of the Alliance are advancing. All this needs to be done in a short time, as if NATO is at war. All this, of course, has happened before. But right now our Western enemy has a real testing ground for testing not only equipment, but also tactics, which they adjust and adapt to modern realities. And each such exercise with seemingly standard tasks should be viewed in this light. High resolution mapEnglish version#Germany #Italy #NATO #USA@rybarSupport us

Title: 🖼 🇺🇸 About the dispersal of AWACS aircraft across European air...
Description: 🇺🇸 On the dispersal of AWACS aircraft across European air bases, on August 23, the NATO command announced an increase in the level of security at the Geilenkirchen air base to -Charlie-, that is, there was a danger based on intelligence data. Subsequently, the danger was reduced to -Bravo+-, but aviation in Germany was still dispersed. Six NATO E-3A airborne early warning aircraft were transported to Rygge airbase in Norway and Konya in Turkey (three each). There are only four units left on Geilenkirchen itself. Another one is in Ingolstadt, three are in Italy. As can be clearly seen, when even the slightest threat appeared in the Alliance, without thinking twice, they moved strategically important aircraft to several other air bases. At the same time, part of this type of aircraft was relocated to Italy back in 2022 as the Northern Military District progressed. This is a really important point that indicates NATO’s careful attitude towards its aircraft. Of course, they presented all this as planned training for pilots, but nevertheless they took precautions.🔻We are now seeing the same tactics. There is a danger - the aircraft are being taken away from the attack. And this is the correct and working method. Unfortunately, it took several lost planes for this to happen, but progress is being made anyway. So, maybe someday we will get to the stage where airfields and air bases will always be equipped with the necessary protective infrastructure from caponiers to the notorious hangars , which are simply necessary to preserve aviation.❗️At the same time, it should be noted that in such a simple way, the Alliance moved two AWACS groups closer to the northern and southern borders of Russia. Three E-3As will be able to virtually cover reconnaissance in their area on a daily basis (the average E-3A flight is 8 hours). Title: 🖼 🇦🇺🇮🇩🇨🇳🇺🇸 How Americans are escalating tension in the A...
Description: 🇦🇺🇮🇩🇨🇳🇺🇸 How Americans are escalating tension in the Asia-Pacific region While NATO members are having fun in Europe on their own with the rather indirect participation of American troops, the Pentagon is resuming major exercises with Asian countries as part of the confrontation with China.▪️Only the day before yesterday we spoke about the flight of B-2A bombers into the Bay of Bengal and  the provocative passage of a US Navy destroyer through the Taiwan Strait, and at the same time, the Pacific Vanguard exercise started at the Guam naval base. This training, in which several US allied countries take part, is aimed at the joint use of naval groups and air support. Here and American destroyers, and South Korean, and Japanese, and even a Canadian frigate arrived to take part. Air support is provided by E/A-18G Growler electronic warfare aircraft, which are also involved in the exercise.▪️And that's not all. Today, another major training begins over Indonesian territory and in the waters to the south, in which the presence of the United States is noted - Super Garuda Shield, and it will last until September 5. The main actors, in addition to Indonesia and the United States, are the Australians, British, Singaporeans and Japanese, who sent their units to actively participate in Super Garuda Shield. In total - about 5.5 thousand people and 800 units of military equipment. Moreover, representatives of 18 countries from Brunei and East Timor to France and the Netherlands are present as observers.🔻That is, counting all the maneuvers that are going on right now off the coast of the Celestial Empire, there is quite a significant number of bombers and a destroyer, as well as exercises in Korea. It’s easy to guess that for the Chinese all these are extremely unpleasant steps that they will not just leave. No wonder, because they are fighting for dominance in the APR. So the increase in the number of aviation flights and the number of ships in nearby waters, as well as repeated flights of bomb carriers to the shores of the United States, clearly should not be forgotten.
